intro: Telesonix jamesii, commonly known as the James' telesonix, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in vibrant shades of red and orange. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, Telesonix jamesii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
